judge.rationale: Multiple results are from no-reply@accounts.google.com with subjects containing 'Security alert' (including 'Critical security alert' and 'Security alert'), matching the query and expectation. Aggregation also shows 4 emails from accounts.google.com.
Matches include multiple emails titled ‚ÄúOpenAI @ UC Berkeley‚Äù and ‚ÄúOpenAI Advisor @ UC Berkeley‚Äù from GPTDAO (kriswang-gptdao.ai), aligning with the expected UC Berkeley event/announcement.
Matches include a recent Yelp email with subject ‚ÄúWait, how was Beastea? üí≠,‚Äù which indicates Yelp asked for feedback/a review. Other matches (e.g., Terms update) don‚Äôt contradict this.
Matches clearly reference Bandsintown and LANY, showing updates about the Soft World Tour (new message, presale code, tickets available), which are sufficient to summarize the update.
Matches include multiple Upwork job alert emails with subjects and brief snippets, sufficient to summarize the alerts with brief job info. No contradictions present.

The only match is a generic weekly inbox summary for 2025-W43 and not specific to the 'OpenAI @ UC Berkeley' thread. It lacks event-focused themes such as OpenAI, Berkeley, or speakers. Aggregation is empty and provides no helpful context.

The monthly summary explicitly highlights job alert themes (AI/GenAI/ML, LLM/agent/RAG, n8n/Make, full‚Äëstack roles) and provides an executive rollup of hiring activity, matching the request and expectation.

Matches list provides recent unread items, which is useful. However, aggregation is inconsistent with matches (4 LinkedIn and 1 Streamlit in matches vs 1 LinkedIn and 4 Streamlit in aggregation). Also, there is no explicit evidence of filtering by a received_after checkpoint, so minimal overlap cannot be verified.
